channel.title: Making items untradeable?
channel.description:
Ok, so. I am trying to make items untradeable. I have a devolution 7 base, but here's the problem, the int and boolean aren't recognized.
[b]Int:[/b] [code] public int[] untradeable = { 14073, 14075, 14076, 14078, 14079, 14081, 14082, 14084 , 14085, 14087, 14088, 14090, 14091, 14093, 14094, 14096, 14097, 14099, 14100, 14103, 14102, 14105, 14106, 14108, 14109, 14111, 14112, 14114, 14115, 14117, 14118, 14120, 14121, 14138, 14139, 14140, 14135, 14136, 14132, 14133, 14129, 14130, 14126, 14127, 14123, 14124}; // Untradeable items[/code] [i]If you notice, I even tried changing the public int untradeable[] to public int[] untradeable.[/i]
[b]Boolean:[/b] [code] public boolean isUntradable(int item) { for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) { if(untradable == item) return true; } return false; }[/code] [i]Everything seems fine with the boolean, I just added it in case you have to test it out.[/i]
[b]Errors:[/b] [code]client.java:108: untradeable is already defined in client public int[] untradeable = { 84,3006,4653,4703,744,793,6959,6070,6603,65 70,3777,1031,3759,3787,3761,2412,378, ^ client.java:83: cannot find symbol symbol : variable untradable location: class client for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) { ^ client.java:84: cannot find symbol symbol : variable untradable location: class client if(untradable == item) ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 3 errors
:: Complete! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
If someone can help me, I'd appreciate it.

item.title: Making items untradeable?
item.dc:creator: @shortysean6 shortysean6
item.description:
@shortysean6 wrote:

[quote=“Lagex, post:1, topic:191969”]Ok, so. I am trying to make items untradeable. I have a devolution 7 base, but here’s the problem, the int and boolean aren’t recognized.

Int:

public int[] untradeable = { 14073, 14075, 14076, 14078, 14079, 14081, 14082, 14084 , 14085, 14087, 14088, 14090, 14091, 14093, 14094, 14096, 14097, 14099, 14100, 14103, 14102, 14105, 14106, 14108, 14109, 14111, 14112, 14114, 14115, 14117, 14118, 14120, 14121, 14138, 14139, 14140, 14135, 14136, 14132, 14133, 14129, 14130, 14126, 14127, 14123, 14124}; // Untradeable items
If you notice, I even tried changing the public int untradeable[] to public int[] untradeable.

Boolean:

public boolean isUntradable(int item) { for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) { if(untradable == item) return true; } return false; }
Everything seems fine with the boolean, I just added it in case you have to test it out.

Errors:

[code]client.java:108: untradeable is already defined in client
public int[] untradeable = { 84,3006,4653,4703,744,793,6959,6070,6603,65
70,3777,1031,3759,3787,3761,2412,378,
^
client.java:83: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable untradable
location: class client
for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) {
^
client.java:84: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable untradable
location: class client
if(untradable == item)
^
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
3 errors

:: Complete!
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

If someone can help me, I’d appreciate it.[/quote]

thats my tut of this

item.title: Making items untradeable?
item.dc:creator: @Lagex Lagex
item.description:
@Lagex wrote:

Ok, so. I am trying to make items untradeable. I have a devolution 7 base, but here’s the problem, the int and boolean aren’t recognized.

Int:

public int[] untradeable = { 14073, 14075, 14076, 14078, 14079, 14081, 14082, 14084 , 14085, 14087, 14088, 14090, 14091, 14093, 14094, 14096, 14097, 14099, 14100, 14103, 14102, 14105, 14106, 14108, 14109, 14111, 14112, 14114, 14115, 14117, 14118, 14120, 14121, 14138, 14139, 14140, 14135, 14136, 14132, 14133, 14129, 14130, 14126, 14127, 14123, 14124}; // Untradeable items
If you notice, I even tried changing the public int untradeable[] to public int[] untradeable.

Boolean:

public boolean isUntradable(int item) { for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) { if(untradable == item) return true; } return false; }
Everything seems fine with the boolean, I just added it in case you have to test it out.

Errors:

[code]client.java:108: untradeable is already defined in client
public int[] untradeable = { 84,3006,4653,4703,744,793,6959,6070,6603,65
70,3777,1031,3759,3787,3761,2412,378,
^
client.java:83: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable untradable
location: class client
for(int i = 0; i < untradable.length; i++) {
^
client.java:84: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable untradable
location: class client
if(untradable == item)
^
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
3 errors

:: Complete!
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

If someone can help me, I’d appreciate it.
